clinical_study.brief_title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir (LPV/r) Tablet in HIV Infected Children
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Low- Dose Lopinavir/Ritonavir Tablet Formulation HIV-1 Infected Children

lead_sponsor.agency: The HIV Netherlands Australia Thailand Research Collaboration

collaborator.agency: UMC St. Radboud, Nijmegen, The Netherlands

clinical_study.source: The HIV Netherlands Australia Thailand Research Collaboration

brief_summary.textblock: To study the pharmacokinetics of low-dose lopinavir/ritonavir tablet in HIV-1 infected Thai children.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, single arm study to compare standard dose with a new tablet formulation of a lower dose of lopinavir/ritonavir in HIV-1 infected children.

primary_outcome.measure: assess the level of lopinavir trough level >1 mg/L in low dose lopinavir (reduction by 70%)

arm_group.description: standard dose of lopinavir/ritonavir 100/25 mg tablet q 12 hour

intervention.description: standard dose of lopinavir/ritonavir 100/25 mg tablet q 12 hour.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. HIV infection
2. Age < 18 years old
3. BW > 25 kg
4. HIV RNA viral load < 50 copies within 6 months
5. Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Active opportunistic infection
2. Relevant history or current condition, illness that might interfere with drug absorption, distribution, metabolism or excretion.
3. Use of concomitant medications that may interfere with the pharmacokinetics of lopinavir/ritonavir
